title: Linux Kernel ksmbd generate_key context.iov_base Null Pointer Dereference Denial-of-Service Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to create a denial-of-service condition on affected installations of the Linux Kernel. Authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the handling of a context value when updating a hash function. The issue results from dereferencing a null pointer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to create a denial-of-service condition on the system.
addtionnal_details: Linux has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://cdn.kernel.org/pub/linux/kernel/v6.x/ChangeLog-6.16.1
timeline:
2025-07-18 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2025-09-24 - Coordinated public release of advisory
2025-09-24 - Advisory Updated
